        String currentOt=mishnayot.get(i).getOt();

        if (_resultId==null)
            throw new IllegalAccessError("missing result id link cannot be created");
        button.setOnClickListener(new OnClickListener() {
            @Override
            public void onClick(View arg0) //make it scroll to correct textview
            {
                new Handler().post(new Runnable() {
                    @Override
                    public void run() {
                        View currentView=findViewById(_resultId.get(index));
                        ScrollView scrollView=(ScrollView) findViewById(R.id.resultScroll);
                        scrollView.scrollTo(0, currentView.getTop());

                });
            }
        });
        navigationLayout.addView(button);//add the button to panel

<<<explanation>>>: The problem with your code is that the variable _counter is being updated in each iteration of the loop, so by the time the onClick method is called, _counter is always equal to the last index. To fix this, you should create a final variable inside the loop that captures the current index. This way, each onClick method will have its own copy of the index at the time the button was created.
